gpt_university_description: Université de Technologie de Troyes (UTT) is a French university located in Troyes, France. It was founded in 1994 and is known for its specialized programs in engineering, technology, and management. It is a member of the Network of Universities of Technology, aimed at providing high-quality education in line with industry needs.
gpt_location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Troyes is relatively low compared to larger French cities like Paris. Students can expect to spend around €600-€800 per month on living expenses, including accommodation, food, and transportation.
gpt_location_weather: Troyes experiences a temperate oceanic climate with four distinct seasons. Winters are cold and rainy, with temperatures ranging from -2°C to 6°C. Summers are warm and mild, with temperatures between 15°C and 25°C. The city typically experiences rainfall throughout the year.
gpt_location_description: Troyes is a historic town in the Champagne-Ardenne region of France, with a rich cultural heritage and striking architecture. The city has a picturesque old town area, lined with cobblestone streets and half-timbered houses, and many museums, galleries, and various recreational activities. Known for its shopping outlets, Troyes offers a mix of traditional and modern living with a friendly atmosphere.
gpt_location_crime: Troyes has a relatively low crime rate, making it a safe city for students and residents alike. Occasional petty crime such as pickpocketing and minor thefts can occur, however, it is essential to take standard precautionary measures.
gpt_location_transportation: Troyes has a well-developed public transportation system, including buses and trams operated by TCAT. The city is also pedestrian-friendly, and many residents choose to walk or cycle around the city center. Troyes is well connected by train to other major cities such as Paris and Reims.
